name: Cecil Taylor
description:
'''Cecil Percival Taylor''' (March 25, 1929{{snd}}April 5, 2018) was an American pianist and poet.{{sfn|Such|1993|p=61}}

Taylor was [[classically trained]] and was one of the pioneers of [[free jazz]]. His music is characterized by an energetic, physical approach, resulting in complex [[Musical improvisation|improvisation]] often involving [[tone clusters]] and intricate [[polyrhythms]]. His technique has been compared to [[Percussion instrument|percussion]]. Referring to the number of keys on a standard piano, [[Val Wilmer]] used the phrase "eighty-eight tuned drums" to describe Taylor's style. He has been referred to as "[[Art Tatum]] with contemporary-classical leanings".
